The Company and AIG agree that any contribution to be made under paragraph 1 will take place within the following two time periods per year, as applicable: (a) during the time beginning on the first business day after the filing of the Company's first 2 fiscal quarterly statutory financial statements and ending on the last business day prior to the end of the Company's second fiscal quarter; and (b) during the time beginning on the first business day after the filing of the Company's third fiscal quarterly statutory financial statements and ending on the last business day prior to the end of the Company's fourth fiscal quarter.
perturbation.changed_text: 3. Timing of Capital Contributions. The Company and AIG agree that any contribution to be made under paragraph 1 will take place within the following two time periods per year, as applicable: (a) during the time beginning on the 30th business day after the filing of the Company's first 2 fiscal quarterly statutory financial statements and ending on the 5th business day after the filing of the Company's first 2 fiscal quarterly statutory financial statements; and (b) during the time beginning on the 30th business day after the filing of the Company's third fiscal quarterly statutory financial statements and ending on the 5th business day after the filing of the Company's third fiscal quarterly statutory financial statements.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by creating an impossibly short and delayed window for capital contributions, potentially violating regulatory requirements for timely capital maintenance. Insurance regulations in Texas and generally require that companies maintain minimum capital levels and address any deficiencies promptly. This change could lead to non-compliance if AIG cannot make the required contributions in such a short time.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Insurance Code and NAIC Model Laws regarding minimum capital requirements for insurance companies.

perturbation.changed_text: 7. Termination. Unless earlier terminated in accordance with this paragraph 7, this Agreement shall continue indefinitely. AIG shall have the absolute right to terminate this Agreement upon five (5) days' prior written notice to the Company, which notice shall state the effective date of termination (the "Termination Date"); provided, however, that AIG agrees not to terminate this Agreement under any circumstances. To the extent not terminated previously by AIG pursuant to the foregoing, this Agreement will terminate automatically one year after the closing of any sale of the Company by AIG, and all provisions hereof will be of no further force and effect.
perturbation.explanation: This change shortens the notice period for termination to 5 days and simultaneously prohibits AIG from terminating the agreement except after the sale of the company. This potentially contradicts regulatory expectations for capital maintenance agreements, which usually require reasonable termination clauses that allow for adjustments in corporate structure. A five-day notice period is insufficient for the Company to arrange alternative capital support, violating the implicit good faith and fair dealing requirements. By prohibiting termination under any circumstances it might not be valid.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, and general insurance regulatory principles requiring reasonable provisions in capital maintenance agreements.

perturbation.original_text: 8. Policyholder Rights. perturbation.changed_text: 8. Policyholder Rights. Any policyholder holding a policy issued by the Company prior to the termination of this Agreement shall have the right to demand that the Company enforce the Company's rights under paragraphs 1, 3 and 4 of this Agreement. However, no policyholder of the Company may take any action authorized under this paragraph 8. AIG has no obligations to the policyholders. Upon termination of this Agreement in accordance with paragraph 7 hereof, the rights of any policyholder as provided for under this paragraph 8 shall terminate immediately.
perturbation.explanation: This change eliminates policyholder rights to enforce the capital maintenance agreement, contradicting the intent of such agreements to protect policyholders. State insurance regulations often mandate that capital maintenance agreements provide some mechanism for policyholder protection, as they are the ultimate beneficiaries of a financially stable insurer. Eliminating policyholder enforcement rights could be deemed an unfair or deceptive practice and may be against public policy, specifically harming those that relied on the solvency of the insurance company.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State insurance regulations regarding policyholder protection and enforcement of capital maintenance agreements.
